intro: Centemopsis filiformis, commonly known as the slender centemopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and small, pale flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
